title.rendered: 8 Ways Social Media Impacts the Way We Design Our Websites Today

content.rendered:
Social media has had a great influence on how businesses operate in the world today. One of its biggest impacts has been on how businesses make their social impact felt. Now, it is changing how web designers create and develop websites to meet customer needs and increase revenue.

The social media world has changed advertisements and also impacted how websites look today. It is a great tool for anyone looking to design a website for their business today. This article takes a more in-depth look at what social media can do to help you succeed in the online world.

Here are some ways through which it impacts web design.

1.   Allow Social Logins

Business-consumer relations have gotten a boost in recent times. Businesses used to interact with consumers through their social media pages in the last couple of decades. But then, social media has changed this by introducing auto logins from various social media channels.

Many internet users get intimidated by websites that require signing up. You save them the hassle when you enable signing up and logging in through social media accounts. Most third-party applications and websites are implementing social logins to enhance UX.

It boosts user registrations and conversions while making it easy for businesses to create internal communities and share specialized content. Good user experiences increase site visits and impact conversion rates, which is vital for any business.

2.   Make Sure Your Content is Shareable

It has become necessary to enable sharing of information from websites to other platforms. Social media has traditionally enabled sharing of content within itself. The sharing of content between social media and websites is a new trend inspired by social media sharing.

As a website owner, you need to ensure that people can share texts, links, images, and videos from your website. You should enable sharing from your website to another or social media platforms. Web designers are keen on taking advantage of this trend.

Focus on creating compelling content that will ignite something in your audience. Besides, include a share button on every page of your site to ensure that your content reaches a wider audience.

3.   Using Images

Social media images bring better results compared to textual content. Many businesses are focusing on creating visual elements that will aid in product advertisements. The success that images have had in social media advertising has made website owners consider using them in their sites.

However, the images used on social media need to get optimized to bring in the desired results. That has also changed how imagery is used on websites. Image optimization has become a critical aspect of websites. Now, you cannot expect excellent results from a website if you do not optimize images properly.

4.   Embed YouTube Videos

YouTube is another critical social media channel that has impacted websites positively. Website owners are taking advantage of YouTube by embedding videos from the platform in their websites. Now, website visitors can watch your YouTube videos without clicking away from your site.

You must keep your business needs in mind when adding videos to your website. Creating short videos that communicate the message quickly will give you the results you desire. Besides, the embedding of YouTube videos in websites has made it vital for businesses to build social media-friendly websites.

5.   Make Your Web Design is Social Media Platform-Friendly

Social media has made it necessary for web designers to create social media channels friendly websites. The entire website design from scratch is now all about keeping social media in mind. The aim is to ensure that websites give users the same user experience level as social media platforms do.

Websites that have adopted social media platforms friendly designs have seen better results than those that haven’t. Now, you’ll find a homepage without static content, unlike before.

Website owners have now made it possible for content to feed on their social media pages.

That makes pages lively as variable content gives life to pages that traditionally should have static content. Consequently, you increase the number of people interacting with your site.

6.   Interactive Designs

Internet users do not easily associate websites with interactive and engaging content. However, social media is popular with such content that often evokes emotions in audiences. As a website owner, making your website interactive as social media will boost your business in several ways and is therefore worth considering.

Whether you’re designing a website for profit or creating strategies for nonprofit digital marketing, you need to keep your brand in mind. It would be best if you were consistent with the website and social media designs to get the desired results.

Users can easily identify your brand if your social media and website look alike. Making sure that your customers interact well with your products. That will generate more leads for you and also increase the sales you make.

7.   Incorporate Facebook Reviews

People consider social media reviews before making purchasing decisions. New clients on your website will probably go back to search engines to determine whether you’re reliable. Many people trust online reviews from previous clients and will purchase from you if they’re positive.

Website designers are now making it easier for people to make purchase decisions. Instead of clicking away from your website to check for reviews, you can design your website and designate a section for reviews. Add screenshots of previous customer reviews, and you’ll reduce the work your clients have to do.

8.   Design for Ads Displayed on Social Media

Social media is one of the best communication tools we have today. It is also one of the free platforms that businesses have to advertise their products and services. There are different ways that businesses package social media advertisements.

Basically, marketers aim to make the ads adapt to the social media channel they would like to post. It has now become necessary that web designers create ads that can adapt to websites too. Well-designed ads can bring desired results whether you post them on social media or your website.

Final Thoughts

To wrap up, you’ll need a good website design if you’re to succeed online. Making your website social media friendly will help you boost site visits and conversions. With social media platforms becoming popular every day, linking them with your site is the best way to build a better site.

Ensure that your website design not only meets your business needs but also matches your social media channels. Creating a website without integrating it with your social media channels no longer makes sense. Understand the role social media plays in promoting interactions.

About the Author

Dan Martin has hands-on experience in digital marketing since 2007. He has been building teams and coaching others to foster innovation and solve real-time problems. Dan also enjoys photography and traveling.
